chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter G Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter G Hamilton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter G Hamilton was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:53 AM Defendant Peter G Hamilton in court, in custody at Columbia County Jail, with attorney Claire M Edwards. ADA Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video, via Zoom. This hearing is in regard to sentence credit.  State's position: sentence credit given at sentencing is correct.  Atty Edwards deferred to the DOC.  Court reviewed credit given and days served by defendant.  Court requested documentation of dates for credit.  Both parties may file briefs with the Court to be submitted by 6/15/2020.   10:20 AM

Defendant, Peter G Hamilton, appeared pro se, in custody. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wished to settle case today. Court advised defendant this is set for a preliminary hearing today. Rights to attorney recited to defendant. State called Officer Brandon Koziel & sworn, Lake Delton P.D., formerly Lodi P.D. Direct examination by ADA Burdon. Officer identified defendant. No cross examination. State rested. State moved for bindover. Statement by defendant. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2017 at 03:40 pm.  Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on 9/21/17 at 9 a.m.
